Hoteli v Istri so med počitnicami dobro zasedeni
01 Nov 2019, 09:46 by STA

Hoteli v slovenski Istri v času krompirjevih počitnic beležijo dobro zasedenost, v piranski občini je bila ta denimo že v začetku tedna približno 75-odstotna, okoli 70-odstotno zasedenost hotelskih zmogljivosti pričakujejo tudi v Kopru. To obdobje je sicer že tradicionalno namenjeno družinskim oddihom, čemur se prilagajajo tudi ponudniki.



Foto: Zdravko Primožič/FPA

PORTOROŽ, PIRAN, KOPER, IZOLA > Hoteli piranske občine Piran so bili že v torek približno 75-odstotno zasedeni, so pojasnili v Turističnem združenju Portorož, kjer boljšo zasedenost pričakujejo ob koncih tedna in za praznike. Tako je bila minulo soboto hotelska zasedenost kar 95-odstotna, rezultati pa so primerljivi oziroma celo za odtenek boljši kot lani.
Sicer pa večji portoroški hoteli v času počitnic ponujajo posebne družinske pakete ter pester animacijski program za družine in otroke, ki vključuje družinsko iskanje skritega zaklada, večerni pohod z baklami, zabavo za noč čarovnic, piknik na plaži s peko hrenovk in krompirja, ustvarjalne in kulinarične delavnice ter rekreativne aktivnosti na bazenu.
V času počitnic so prevladovale družine
Samo v Hotelih Bernardin, ki v Portorožu, Strunjanu in Izoli skupno upravlja s skoraj 1200 hotelskimi sobami, so v tem času v povprečju zasedeni 85-odstotno, kar je primerljivo z lanskim letom. Kot so navedli, so v času počitnic prevladovale predvsem družine. Največ je bilo slovenskih gostov, med vikendi pa tudi nekoliko več Italijanov in Avstrijcev.
V Turistični organizaciji Koper so navedli, da bodo nastanitvene kapacitete v občini med krompirjevimi počitnicami glede na trenutne podatke dobro zasedene, in sicer v povprečju 70-odstotno. Med gosti pričakujejo največ Slovencev (približno 70 odstotkov), od tujih gostov pa največ Italijanov.
V Izoli kraljestvo rib
Nekateri koprski hoteli so pripravili posebne pakete za družine, v sredo so v mediteranskem vrtu Purissima na Škofijah za otroke pripravili Noč čarovnic s pestro animacijo in delavnicami. Vrata pa v teh dneh odpirajo tudi posamezne osmice na koprskem podeželju.
V Izolo medtem te dni vabijo dnevi kraljestva ribe. Do 9. novembra bo 17 različnih izolskih restavracij in gostiln ponujalo posebne menije z ribjimi specialitetami. Že pred dnevi pa so v Turističnem združenju Izola postregli z uradnimi podatki o minulem turističnem obisku. Tako so v izolski občini v septembru zabeležili 52.705 nočitev oziroma tri odstotke več kot v enakem obdobju lani. Domačih gostov je bilo 42 odstotkov, sledili so Nemci, Avstrijci, Italijani in Čehi. V prvih devetih mesecih pa so v Izoli dosegli skoraj 457.000 nočitev, kar predstavlja sedemodstotno rast glede na leto prej.
text:
Hotels in Istria are well occupied during the holidays
01 Nov 2019, 09:46 by STA

Hotels in Slovenian Istria have a good occupancy rate during the potato holidays; for example, in the municipality of Piran this week it was about 75%, and about 70% is expected to occupy hotel facilities in Koper. This period is traditionally intended for family vacations, which is also adjusted by providers.



Photo: Zdravko Primozic / FPA

PORTOROZ, PIRAN, KOPER, IZOLA> Hotels in Piran municipality were already around 75% occupied on Tuesday, explained the Tourist Association of Portorož, where better occupancy is expected at weekends and holidays. So, last Saturday, hotel occupancy was as high as 95%, and the results are comparable or even better than last year.
Other major hotels in Portorož offer special family packages and a varied animation program for families and children during the holidays, which includes a family treasure hunt, a torch evening, a Halloween party, a picnic on the beach with fries and potatoes, creative and culinary workshops and recreational activities at the pool.
Families dominated the holidays
In the Bernardin Hotels alone, which in Portorož, Strunjan and Izola together manage almost 1,200 hotel rooms, they occupy an average of 85% during this time, which is comparable to last year. As they stated, families mostly dominated during the holidays. The majority were Slovenian guests, while on weekends there were also slightly more Italians and Austrians.
According to the Tourist Organization of Koper, accommodation capacities in the municipality will be well occupied during the potato holidays, according to current data, on average 70%. Most Slovenes (about 70 percent) are expected to receive guests, while the majority of foreign guests expect Italians.
In Izola, the kingdom of fish
Some Koper hotels have prepared special packages for families, and on Wednesday the Purissima Mediterranean Garden in Dioceses for Children prepared Halloween with a variety of animation and workshops. These days, however, the doors also open up individual eights in the Koper countryside.
In the meantime, the kingdom of fish invites you to Izola. By November 9, 17 different Isola restaurants and inns will be offering specialty fish specialty menus. Just days ago, the Izola Tourism Association provided official information on past tourist visits. In September, the municipality of Izola recorded 52,705 overnight stays, which is three percent more than in the same period last year. Domestic guests were 42 percent, followed by Germans, Austrians, Italians and Czechs. In the first nine months of the year, Izola reached almost 457,000 overnight stays, which is a seven percent growth over the previous year.
